headline.main: Vatican's Australian Finance Chief Rejects 'Baseless' Child Abuse Allegations
headline.print_headline: Vatican's Australian Finance Chief Rejects 'Baseless' Child Abuse Allegations

docs.snippet: The Australian cardinal who oversees the Vatican's finances has strongly denied newspaper allegations of involvement in child sexual abuse, describing them as "utterly false"....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Australian cardinal who oversees the Vatican's finances has strongly denied newspaper allegations of involvement in child sexual abuse, describing them as "utterly false".

headline.main: Nashville, Tampa, Miami Police Unions Urge Boycotts of Beyonce Shows
headline.print_headline: Nashville, Tampa, Miami Police Unions Urge Boycotts of Beyonce Shows

docs.snippet: Police unions in Nashville, Tampa and Miami are urging officers not to volunteer to work security at pop star Beyonce's upcoming concerts in those cities, because of what they say was an anti-police message when she performed at the Super Bowl....
docs.lead_paragraph: Police unions in Nashville, Tampa and Miami are urging officers not to volunteer to work security at pop star Beyonce's upcoming concerts in those cities, because of what they say was an anti-police message when she performed at the Super Bowl.

headline.main: How to Win the Tax Game and Play Within Its Complex Rules

docs.snippet: Various breaks can reduce tax bills. Here is a look at what helped one hypothetical suburban New York couple — and what might work for you....
docs.lead_paragraph: Various breaks can reduce tax bills. Here is a look at what helped one hypothetical suburban New York couple — and what might work for you.

headline.main: Trump Calls for Boycott Until Apple Unlocks Shooter's Phone
headline.print_headline: Trump Calls for Boycott Until Apple Unlocks Shooter's Phone

docs.snippet: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump called on Friday for a boycott of Apple Inc products until the tech company agreed to help the U.S. government unlock the cellphone of one of the killers in last year's San Bernardino, California, sho...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump called on Friday for a boycott of Apple Inc products until the tech company agreed to help the U.S. government unlock the cellphone of one of the killers in last year's San Bernardino, California, shooting.

headline.main: Facebook Updates Messenger App to Handle Several Accounts
headline.print_headline: Facebook Updates Messenger App to Handle Several Accounts

docs.snippet: Facebook has redesigned its popular Messenger app so several people can use it on the same smartphone or tablet without relinquishing their privacy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Facebook has redesigned its popular Messenger app so several people can use it on the same smartphone or tablet without relinquishing their privacy.

headline.main: Turkey Says Obama Shares Syria Concerns With Erdogan, Affirms Support
headline.print_headline: Turkey Says Obama Shares Syria Concerns With Erdogan, Affirms Support

docs.snippet: Turkey's presidency said on Friday U.S. President Barack Obama had expressed concern over the advance of Syrian government and Kurdish YPG forces in northwestern Syria in a telephone call with his Turkish counterpart Tayyip Erdogan....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey's presidency said on Friday U.S. President Barack Obama had expressed concern over the advance of Syrian government and Kurdish YPG forces in northwestern Syria in a telephone call with his Turkish counterpart Tayyip Erdogan.

headline.main: Anti-Money Laundering Body Urges More Scrutiny of Iran, North Korea
headline.print_headline: Anti-Money Laundering Body Urges More Scrutiny of Iran, North Korea

docs.snippet: An international anti-money laundering group wants government  financial intelligence agencies to give extra scrutiny to transactions and business relationships involving Iran and North Korea....
docs.lead_paragraph: An international anti-money laundering group wants government  financial intelligence agencies to give extra scrutiny to transactions and business relationships involving Iran and North Korea.

headline.main: Sheriff Faces Misdemeanor After Dying Inmate Didn't Get Care
headline.print_headline: Sheriff Faces Misdemeanor After Dying Inmate Didn't Get Care

docs.snippet: A sheriff in a county on the edge of western North Dakota's oil patch faces misdemeanor charges in the death of a county jail inmate after allegedly refusing to get him medical attention due to "dollars and cents," court records show....
docs.lead_paragraph: A sheriff in a county on the edge of western North Dakota's oil patch faces misdemeanor charges in the death of a county jail inmate after allegedly refusing to get him medical attention due to "dollars and cents," court records show.

headline.main: Southwest Airlines' Ground Staff Approve Wage-Hike Contract
headline.print_headline: Southwest Airlines' Ground Staff Approve Wage-Hike Contract

docs.snippet: Southwest Airlines Co's ground staff narrowly approved a tentative agreement, which includes pay raises of more than 20 percent over the five-year life of the contract, the union representing the workers said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Southwest Airlines Co's ground staff narrowly approved a tentative agreement, which includes pay raises of more than 20 percent over the five-year life of the contract, the union representing the workers said.

headline.main: Canada Divided as 25,000 Syrian Refugees Settle In
headline.print_headline: Canada Divided as 25,000 Syrian Refugees Settle In

docs.snippet: Canadians remain divided about the resettlement of Syrian refugees, with some saying Canada should accept more despite a series of racist incidents that have marred a mostly smooth arrival of nearly 25,000 migrants, a poll showed on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Canadians remain divided about the resettlement of Syrian refugees, with some saying Canada should accept more despite a series of racist incidents that have marred a mostly smooth arrival of nearly 25,000 migrants, a poll showed on Friday.
